**Hack 1.0.2** is the third public release of [Hack](/wiki/Hack "Hack"). [Andries Brouwer](/wiki/Andries_Brouwer "Andries Brouwer") published it to the (now-obsolete) [Usenet](/wiki/Usenet "Usenet") newsgroup net.sources.games in April 1985.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Availability](#Availability)

- [2 Significant changes](#Significant_changes)

- [3 The adventurer](#The_adventurer)

- [4 Dungeon features](#Dungeon_features)

- [5 Bestiary](#Bestiary)

- [6 Objects](#Objects)

  - [6.1 Artifacts](#Artifacts)
  - [6.2 Amulets](#Amulets)
  - [6.3 Food](#Food)
  - [6.4 Weapons](#Weapons)

  - [6.6 Armor](#Armor)
  - [6.7 Potions](#Potions)
  - [6.8 Scrolls](#Scrolls)
  - [6.9 Wands](#Wands)
  - [6.10 Rings](#Rings)
  - [6.11 Gems](#Gems)
  - [6.12 Other items](#Other_items)

## Availability

Google Groups has archived nine of the ten original postings to net.sources.games, but not part 2. This is possibly due to the same problem with the rumors file which affected part 15 of [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"):

- [Part 1](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/q2qZ39dMGOQ/6mmwYjMIRLkJ)
- *Part 2 is missing [(second archive)](https://web.archive.org/web/20060505171210/http://vmsone.com/~decuslib/unixsig/uni87a/hack/part2.)*
- [Part 3](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/7OyHZBMS9Pc/zFi2aCjUa_oJ)
- [Part 4](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/f6Ras65IYTM/5IdNvQK1TA8J)
- [Part 5](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/7tDpSMKz5nQ/Ea4ce16GPacJ)
- [Part 6](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/SPfxgd91Y1I/_T9S-m6yh4cJ)
- [Part 7](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/qJYA0JzIMo4/b1Rr2jUG0xUJ)
- [Part 8](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/Vt3_cnKQCZ4/FpwMudSxVqoJ)
- [Part 9](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/OwJkPfAtO7I/W6tf8Ce0x6oJ)
- [Part 10](https://groups.google.com/forum/message/raw?msg=net.sources.games/i39uwS_8QPQ/hI8TvbuEBFYJ) (including ed commands, see below)

These are mostly typical shar files. Part 10 is a bit different in that, after extracting its contents, it invokes ed to patch some of the files from previous parts.

A [second archive](http://www.digiater.nl/openvms/decus/uni87a/hack/) also preserves Hack 1.0.2. Part 2 appears to be intact in this archive, but parts 1 and 8 are somewhat altered, most notably changing the [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode") account to "kimery". [Mrynet.com](ftp://ftp.mrynet.com/operatingsystems/DEC/vmsone/vmsone.com/~decuslib/unixsig/uni87a/hack/index.html%3FS%3DD) has another copy of the second archive of Hack 1.0.2. Andries Brouwer has mirrored both archives on his [web site](http://homepages.cwi.nl/~aeb/games/hack/hack.html).

[Ali Harlow](/wiki/Ali_Harlow "Ali Harlow")[\[1\]](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/front.html) has a Hack 1.0.2 distribution at [\[2\]](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/source/ab_hack-1.0.2.tar.gz). This distribution does not have the benefit of the second archive.

## Significant changes

- The player may now choose to play as female.

- The [wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), [giant eel](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel"), [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound"), and [mail daemon](/wiki/Mail_daemon "Mail daemon") join the bestiary.

- The first [phase of the moon](/wiki/Phase_of_the_moon "Phase of the moon") effects are introduced:

  - Cockatrice hissing always stones at new moon unless the adventurer is carrying a [dead lizard](/wiki/Lizard_corpse "Lizard corpse").
  - Full moon boosts luck by one point.
  - Attempting to [tame](/wiki/Pet "Pet") a [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") at full moon usually fails.
  - Dogs and hell hounds attacking at full moon do extra damage.

- The [lump of royal jelly](/wiki/Lump_of_royal_jelly "Lump of royal jelly"), [scroll of mail](/wiki/Scroll_of_mail "Scroll of mail"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), and [can opener](/wiki/Can_opener "Can opener") join the object list.

- New room types are [swamp](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp"), [beehive](/wiki/Beehive "Beehive"), and [crypt](/wiki/Crypt "Crypt"). [Treasure zoos](/wiki/Zoo "Zoo") are no longer affected by a login name of "david".

- [Pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") appear for the first time.

- Dungeon level 30 and deeper require [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") to enter. (See [Hell](/wiki/Hell "Hell")).

- The "mklev" program, used in earlier versions to create the level files, is merged into the main binary.

The swamp and the giant eel are drawn from [PDP-11 Hack](/wiki/PDP-11_Hack "PDP-11 Hack") and the Hack 1.0.2 source credits the creators of that version, Michiel Huisjes and Fred de Wilde, for the inspiration.

## The adventurer

The player may choose a [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), a [Speleologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"), a [Fighter](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), a [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), a [Cave-(wo)man](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), or a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"). All classes permit male and female adventurers.

The adventurer has [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience"), [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), and [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"). He may advance to [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 14.

The initial [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a little [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog").

## Dungeon features

The dungeon in Hack 1.0.2 has no branches; there is one way up and one way down. The first 25 levels or so consist of rooms, and beyond that, the adventurer encounters mazes.

Dungeon level 30 and deeper are designated as "[Hell](/wiki/Hell "Hell")". Entering hell without fire resistance is an [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath"). Due to a bug, fixed in [Hack 1.0.3](/wiki/Hack_1.0.3 "Hack 1.0.3"), one could enter hell with a [ring of fire resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_fire_resistance "Ring of fire resistance") and take it off once there. ([Gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") and self-[polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") did not yet exist.)

Special rooms are [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), [beehives](/wiki/Beehive "Beehive"), [crypts](/wiki/Crypt "Crypt"), [swamps](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp"), [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo"), and [vaults](/wiki/Vault "Vault").

Traps are:

- [bear trap](/wiki/Bear_trap "Bear trap")
- [arrow trap](/wiki/Arrow_trap "Arrow trap")
- [dart trap](/wiki/Dart_trap "Dart trap")
- [trapdoor](/wiki/Trapdoor "Trapdoor")
- [teleportation trap](/wiki/Teleportation_trap "Teleportation trap")
- [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit")
- [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap")

The [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") is found in the possession of the [wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") in a maze level. He is in a small room in the center of a maze level, surrounded by water and accompanied by a [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound").

Other maze levels have [wands of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") tucked under a boulder in a dead-end square. (Yes, there's more than one.) Since [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), one version of [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")'s lair has a random wand in a similar spot, commemorating the former location of the wand of wishing.

## Objects

New objects to this version are indicated in boldface.

### Artifacts

Hack 1.0.2 has only one [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"). Any [two handed sword](/wiki/Two_handed_sword "Two handed sword") may be named Orcrist and will do d10 extra points damage to [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)"). There can even be more than one Orcrist.

### Amulets

Only the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") and the cheap plastic imitation exist in Hack 1.0.2.

### Food

Food items in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [food ration](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- [tripe ration](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration")
- [pancake](/wiki/Pancake "Pancake")
- [dead lizard](/wiki/Lizard_corpse "Lizard corpse")
- [fortune cookie](/wiki/Fortune_cookie "Fortune cookie")
- [carrot](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot")
- [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin")
- [orange](/wiki/Orange "Orange")
- [apple](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- [pear](/wiki/Pear "Pear")
- [melon](/wiki/Melon "Melon")
- [banana](/wiki/Banana "Banana")
- [candy bar](/wiki/Candy_bar "Candy bar")
- [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg")
- [clove of garlic](/wiki/Clove_of_garlic "Clove of garlic")
- **[lump of royal jelly](/wiki/Lump_of_royal_jelly "Lump of royal jelly")**
- [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") (called *dead foo* rather than *foo corpse*)

The tin did not contain the remains of monsters, but rather a randomly-chosen food such as peaches or, if the adventurer is lucky, [spinach](/wiki/Spinach "Spinach").

The dead lizard was a found object rather than a corpse; live lizards did not exist in Hack 1.0.2. It could reduce [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") and carrying it cancelled the effects of the [new moon](/wiki/Phase_of_the_moon "Phase of the moon"), but had no effect on [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") as this was still an [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath").

### Weapons

Weapons in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [arrow](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow")
- sling bullet
- [crossbow bolt](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt")
- [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock")
- [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang")
- [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace")
- [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe")
- [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail")
- [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")
- [two handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword")
- [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- [worm tooth](/wiki/Worm_tooth "Worm tooth")
- [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife")
- [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")
- [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")
- [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")
- [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")

### Tools

Tools in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [whistle](/wiki/Tin_whistle "Tin whistle")
- [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle")
- [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera")
- [ice box](/wiki/Ice_box "Ice box")
- **[pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe")**
- **[can opener](/wiki/Tin_opener "Tin opener")**

The ice box is the only container. Then as now, it preserved corpses, and was generally too heavy (and too rare) to be useful for inventory management.

### Armor

Armor items in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet")
- [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail")
- [splint mail](/wiki/Splint_mail "Splint mail")
- [banded mail](/wiki/Banded_mail "Banded mail")
- [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail")
- [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail")
- [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail")
- [studded leather armor](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor")
- [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor")
- [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak")
- [shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield")
- [pair of gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")

### Potions

Potions in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [potion of restore strength](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability")
- [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze")
- [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility")
- [potion of fruit juice](/wiki/Potion_of_fruit_juice "Potion of fruit juice")
- [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing")
- [potion of paralysis](/wiki/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis")
- [potion of monster detection](/wiki/Potion_of_monster_detection "Potion of monster detection")
- [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection")
- [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")
- [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion")
- [potion of gain strength](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_ability "Potion of gain ability")
- [potion of speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed")
- [potion of blindness](/wiki/Potion_of_blindness "Potion of blindness")
- [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level")
- [potion of extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing")
- [potion of levitation](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation")

### Scrolls

Scrolls in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- **[scroll of mail](/wiki/Scroll_of_mail "Scroll of mail")** (if MAIL defined at compile time)
- [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor")
- [scroll of destroy armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_destroy_armor "Scroll of destroy armor")
- [scroll of confuse monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_confuse_monster "Scroll of confuse monster")
- [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster")
- [scroll of blank paper](/wiki/Scroll_of_blank_paper "Scroll of blank paper")
- [scroll of remove curse](/wiki/Scroll_of_remove_curse "Scroll of remove curse")
- [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon")
- scroll of damage weapon
- [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster")
- [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming")
- [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide")
- [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light")
- [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")
- [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection")
- [scroll of food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection")
- [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify")
- [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping")
- [scroll of amnesia](/wiki/Scroll_of_amnesia "Scroll of amnesia")
- [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire")
- [scroll of punishment](/wiki/Scroll_of_punishment "Scroll of punishment")

The scroll of damage weapon acts as the modern scroll of enchant weapon does when [cursed](/wiki/Curse "Curse"). The scroll of genocide acts, in all cases, as the modern blessed scroll; but most symbols refer to only one monster anyway.

### Wands

Wands in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [wand of light](/wiki/Wand_of_light "Wand of light")
- [wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection")
- [wand of create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster")
- [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")
- [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking")
- [wand of slow monster](/wiki/Wand_of_slow_monster "Wand of slow monster")
- [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster")
- [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning")
- [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")
- [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation")
- [wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") *(formerly "wand of teleport monster")*
- [wand of make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible")
- [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging")
- [wand of magic missile](/wiki/Wand_of_magic_missile "Wand of magic missile")
- [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")
- [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep")
- [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold")
- [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death")

### Rings

Rings in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [ring of adornment](/wiki/Ring_of_adornment "Ring of adornment")
- [ring of teleportation](/wiki/Ring_of_teleportation "Ring of teleportation")
- [ring of regeneration](/wiki/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration")
- [ring of searching](/wiki/Ring_of_searching "Ring of searching")
- [ring of see invisible](/wiki/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible")
- [ring of stealth](/wiki/Ring_of_stealth "Ring of stealth")
- [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation")
- [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance")
- [ring of aggravate monster](/wiki/Ring_of_aggravate_monster "Ring of aggravate monster")
- [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger")
- [ring of fire resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_fire_resistance "Ring of fire resistance")
- [ring of cold resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_cold_resistance "Ring of cold resistance")
- [ring of protection from shape changers](/wiki/Ring_of_protection_from_shape_changers "Ring of protection from shape changers")
- [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict")
- [ring of gain strength](/wiki/Ring_of_gain_strength "Ring of gain strength")
- [ring of increase damage](/wiki/Ring_of_increase_damage "Ring of increase damage")
- [ring of protection](/wiki/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection")
- [ring of warning](/wiki/Ring_of_warning "Ring of warning")
- [ring of teleport control](/wiki/Ring_of_teleport_control "Ring of teleport control")

Because [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") does not exist in Hack 1.0.2, the ring of adornment is a useless item.

### Gems

Gems in Hack 1.0.2 are:

- [diamond](/wiki/Diamond "Diamond")
- [ruby](/wiki/Ruby "Ruby")
- [sapphire](/wiki/Sapphire "Sapphire")
- [emerald](/wiki/Emerald "Emerald")
- [turquoise stone](/wiki/Turquoise_stone "Turquoise stone")
- [aquamarine stone](/wiki/Aquamarine_stone "Aquamarine stone")
- [tourmaline stone](/wiki/Tourmaline_stone "Tourmaline stone")
- [topaz stone](/wiki/Topaz_stone "Topaz stone")
- [opal stone](/wiki/Opal_stone "Opal stone")
- [garnet stone](/wiki/Garnet_stone "Garnet stone")
- [amethyst stone](/wiki/Amethyst_stone "Amethyst stone")
- [agate stone](/wiki/Agate_stone "Agate stone")
- [onyx stone](/wiki/Onyx_stone "Onyx stone")
- [jasper stone](/wiki/Jasper_stone "Jasper stone")
- [jade stone](/wiki/Jade_stone "Jade stone")

and worthless pieces of blue, red, yellow, and green glass.

### Other items

Other items not appearing in the above categories are:

- [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball")
- [iron chain](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain")
- [enormous rock](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder")

It is not possible to pick up an iron chain, nor can they be generated from [iron golems](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), because these do not exist in Hack 1.0.2.
html:
Hack 1.0.2

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

NetHack Versions

  • Jay Fenlason's Hack
    • HACK for UNIX
    • Hack 1.21 for DOS
    • Hack for PDP-11
    • PC/IX Hack
  • Andries Brouwer's Hack
    • Hack 1.0
    • Hack 1.0.1
    • Hack 1.0.2
    • Hack 1.0.3
  • Early NetHack
    • NetHack 1.3d
    • NetHack 1.4f
    • NetHack 2.2a
    • NetHack 2.3e
  • The NetHack 3.0 Series
    • NetHack 3.0.0
    • NetHack 3.0.1
    • NetHack 3.0.2
    • NetHack 3.0.3
    • NetHack 3.0.4
    • NetHack 3.0.5
    • NetHack 3.0.6
    • NetHack 3.0.7
    • NetHack 3.0.8
    • NetHack 3.0.9
    • NetHack 3.0.10
  • The NetHack 3.1 Series
    • NetHack 3.1.0
    • NetHack 3.1.1
    • NetHack 3.1.2
    • NetHack 3.1.3
  • The NetHack 3.2 Series
    • NetHack 3.2.0
    • NetHack 3.2.1
    • NetHack 3.2.2
    • NetHack 3.2.3
  • The NetHack 3.3 Series
    • NetHack 3.3.0
    • NetHack 3.3.1
  • The NetHack 3.4 Series
    • NetHack 3.4.0
    • NetHack 3.4.1
    • NetHack 3.4.2
    • NetHack 3.4.3
  • The NetHack 3.6 Series
    • NetHack 3.6.0
    • NetHack 3.6.1
    • NetHack 3.6.2
    • NetHack 3.6.3
    • NetHack 3.6.4
    • NetHack 3.6.5
    • NetHack 3.6.6
    • NetHack 3.6.7

Hack 1.0.2 is the third public release of Hack. Andries Brouwer published it to the (now-obsolete) Usenet newsgroup net.sources.games in April 1985.

Contents

  • 1 Availability
  • 2 Significant changes
  • 3 The adventurer
  • 4 Dungeon features
  • 5 Bestiary
  • 6 Objects
    • 6.1 Artifacts
    • 6.2 Amulets
    • 6.3 Food
    • 6.4 Weapons
    • 6.5 Tools
    • 6.6 Armor
    • 6.7 Potions
    • 6.8 Scrolls
    • 6.9 Wands
    • 6.10 Rings
    • 6.11 Gems
    • 6.12 Other items

Availability

Google Groups has archived nine of the ten original postings to net.sources.games, but not part 2. This is possibly due to the same problem with the rumors file which affected part 15 of Hack 1.0:

  • Part 1
  • Part 2 is missing (second archive)
  • Part 3
  • Part 4
  • Part 5
  • Part 6
  • Part 7
  • Part 8
  • Part 9
  • Part 10 (including ed commands, see below)

These are mostly typical shar files. Part 10 is a bit different in that, after extracting its contents, it invokes ed to patch some of the files from previous parts.

A second archive also preserves Hack 1.0.2. Part 2 appears to be intact in this archive, but parts 1 and 8 are somewhat altered, most notably changing the wizard mode account to "kimery". Mrynet.com has another copy of the second archive of Hack 1.0.2. Andries Brouwer has mirrored both archives on his web site.

Ali Harlow[1] has a Hack 1.0.2 distribution at [2]. This distribution does not have the benefit of the second archive.

Significant changes

  • The player may now choose to play as female.
  • The wizard of Yendor, giant eel, hell hound, and mail daemon join the bestiary.
  • The first phase of the moon effects are introduced:
    • Cockatrice hissing always stones at new moon unless the adventurer is carrying a dead lizard.
    • Full moon boosts luck by one point.
    • Attempting to tame a dog at full moon usually fails.
    • Dogs and hell hounds attacking at full moon do extra damage.
  • The lump of royal jelly, scroll of mail, pick-axe, and can opener join the object list.
  • New room types are swamp, beehive, and crypt. Treasure zoos are no longer affected by a login name of "david".
  • Pools appear for the first time.
  • Dungeon level 30 and deeper require fire resistance to enter. (See Hell).
  • The "mklev" program, used in earlier versions to create the level files, is merged into the main binary.

The swamp and the giant eel are drawn from PDP-11 Hack and the Hack 1.0.2 source credits the creators of that version, Michiel Huisjes and Fred de Wilde, for the inspiration.

The adventurer

The player may choose a Tourist, a Speleologist, a Fighter, a Knight, a Cave-(wo)man, or a Wizard. All classes permit male and female adventurers.

The adventurer has experience, hit points, armor class, and strength. He may advance to experience level 14.

The initial pet is a little dog.

Dungeon features

The dungeon in Hack 1.0.2 has no branches; there is one way up and one way down. The first 25 levels or so consist of rooms, and beyond that, the adventurer encounters mazes.

Dungeon level 30 and deeper are designated as "Hell". Entering hell without fire resistance is an instadeath. Due to a bug, fixed in Hack 1.0.3, one could enter hell with a ring of fire resistance and take it off once there. (Gremlins and self-polymorph did not yet exist.)

Special rooms are shops, beehives, crypts, swamps, treasure zoos, and vaults.

Traps are:

  • bear trap
  • arrow trap
  • dart trap
  • trapdoor
  • teleportation trap
  • pit
  • sleeping gas trap

The Amulet of Yendor is found in the possession of the wizard of Yendor in a maze level. He is in a small room in the center of a maze level, surrounded by water and accompanied by a hell hound.

Other maze levels have wands of wishing tucked under a boulder in a dead-end square. (Yes, there's more than one.) Since NetHack 3.1.0, one version of Medusa's lair has a random wand in a similar spot, commemorating the former location of the wand of wishing.

Bestiary

Monsters that are new to this version are noted in boldface.

The following monsters may be encountered:

Name Symbol Notes
acid blob a  
bat B  
centaur C  
chameleon :  
cockatrice c Stoning by hissing is an instadeath
demon &  
dog d  
dragon D As the modern red dragon
ettin e  
floating eye E  
fog cloud f  
freezing sphere F  
gelatinous cube g  
ghost (space)  
giant ant A  
giant beetle b  
giant eel ;  
giant rat r  
gnome G  
guard @  
hell hound d Does not have a breath weapon
hobgoblin H  
homunculus h  
imp i  
jackal J  
jaguar j  
killer bee k  
kobold K  
large dog d  
leocrotta l  
leprechaun L  
little dog d  
long worm w if NOWORM not defined at compile time
lurker above '  
mail daemon 2 if MAIL defined at compile time
mimic M  
minotaur m  
nurse n  
nymph N  
orc O  
owlbear o  
piercer p  
purple worm P  
quasit Q  
quivering blob q  
rust monster R Reduces enchantment rather than truly rusting
scorpion s  
shopkeeper @  
snake S  
stalker I  
tengu t  
trapper ,  
troll T  
umber hulk U  
unicorn u  
vampire V  
violet fungi v  
wizard of Yendor 1  
wraith W  
wumpus w if NOWORM defined at compile time
xan x  
xorn X  
yellow light y  
yeti Y  
zombie Z  
zruty z  

Objects

New objects to this version are indicated in boldface.

Artifacts

Hack 1.0.2 has only one artifact, Orcrist. Any two handed sword may be named Orcrist and will do d10 extra points damage to orcs. There can even be more than one Orcrist.

Amulets

Only the Amulet of Yendor and the cheap plastic imitation exist in Hack 1.0.2.

Food

Food items in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • food ration
  • tripe ration
  • pancake
  • dead lizard
  • fortune cookie
  • carrot
  • tin
  • orange
  • apple
  • pear
  • melon
  • banana
  • candy bar
  • egg
  • clove of garlic
  • lump of royal jelly
  • corpse (called dead foo rather than foo corpse)

The tin did not contain the remains of monsters, but rather a randomly-chosen food such as peaches or, if the adventurer is lucky, spinach.

The dead lizard was a found object rather than a corpse; live lizards did not exist in Hack 1.0.2. It could reduce confusion and carrying it cancelled the effects of the new moon, but had no effect on stoning as this was still an instadeath.

Weapons

Weapons in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • arrow
  • sling bullet
  • crossbow bolt
  • dart
  • rock
  • boomerang
  • mace
  • axe
  • flail
  • long sword
  • two handed sword
  • dagger
  • worm tooth
  • crysknife
  • spear
  • bow
  • sling
  • crossbow

Tools

Tools in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • whistle
  • magic whistle
  • expensive camera
  • ice box
  • pick-axe
  • can opener

The ice box is the only container. Then as now, it preserved corpses, and was generally too heavy (and too rare) to be useful for inventory management.

Armor

Armor items in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • helmet
  • plate mail
  • splint mail
  • banded mail
  • chain mail
  • scale mail
  • ring mail
  • studded leather armor
  • leather armor
  • elven cloak
  • shield
  • pair of gloves

Potions

Potions in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • potion of restore strength
  • potion of booze
  • potion of invisibility
  • potion of fruit juice
  • potion of healing
  • potion of paralysis
  • potion of monster detection
  • potion of object detection
  • potion of sickness
  • potion of confusion
  • potion of gain strength
  • potion of speed
  • potion of blindness
  • potion of gain level
  • potion of extra healing
  • potion of levitation

Scrolls

Scrolls in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • scroll of mail (if MAIL defined at compile time)
  • scroll of enchant armor
  • scroll of destroy armor
  • scroll of confuse monster
  • scroll of scare monster
  • scroll of blank paper
  • scroll of remove curse
  • scroll of enchant weapon
  • scroll of damage weapon
  • scroll of create monster
  • scroll of taming
  • scroll of genocide
  • scroll of light
  • scroll of teleportation
  • scroll of gold detection
  • scroll of food detection
  • scroll of identify
  • scroll of magic mapping
  • scroll of amnesia
  • scroll of fire
  • scroll of punishment

The scroll of damage weapon acts as the modern scroll of enchant weapon does when cursed. The scroll of genocide acts, in all cases, as the modern blessed scroll; but most symbols refer to only one monster anyway.

Wands

Wands in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • wand of light
  • wand of secret door detection
  • wand of create monster
  • wand of wishing
  • wand of striking
  • wand of slow monster
  • wand of speed monster
  • wand of undead turning
  • wand of polymorph
  • wand of cancellation
  • wand of teleportation (formerly "wand of teleport monster")
  • wand of make invisible
  • wand of digging
  • wand of magic missile
  • wand of fire
  • wand of sleep
  • wand of cold
  • wand of death

Rings

Rings in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • ring of adornment
  • ring of teleportation
  • ring of regeneration
  • ring of searching
  • ring of see invisible
  • ring of stealth
  • ring of levitation
  • ring of poison resistance
  • ring of aggravate monster
  • ring of hunger
  • ring of fire resistance
  • ring of cold resistance
  • ring of protection from shape changers
  • ring of conflict
  • ring of gain strength
  • ring of increase damage
  • ring of protection
  • ring of warning
  • ring of teleport control

Because charisma does not exist in Hack 1.0.2, the ring of adornment is a useless item.

Gems

Gems in Hack 1.0.2 are:

  • diamond
  • ruby
  • sapphire
  • emerald
  • turquoise stone
  • aquamarine stone
  • tourmaline stone
  • topaz stone
  • opal stone
  • garnet stone
  • amethyst stone
  • agate stone
  • onyx stone
  • jasper stone
  • jade stone

and worthless pieces of blue, red, yellow, and green glass.

Other items

Other items not appearing in the above categories are:

  • heavy iron ball
  • iron chain
  • enormous rock

It is not possible to pick up an iron chain, nor can they be generated from iron golems, because these do not exist in Hack 1.0.2.
